result.execSummary:
The defendant Sade C Teague was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
EACH COUNT: Provide a DNA sample if not already done so. Pay all remaining costs, surcharges and assessments, any cash bail to apply, remaining balance to be paid during the period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Pay supervision fees.

- Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
- Defendant to have a Mental Health Evaluation and cooperate with any treatment.
- Participate in parenting classes.

- Obtain an AODA assessment and follow-up treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes:
AS TO EACH COUNT, No release privileges. This time is stayed pending request from probation agent.
*5/11/2017  To serve 30 days. Straight time.  Order for Commitment signed/filed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sade C Teague

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
The defendant is in absconder status.  The Court lifted the stay on the conditional time of 30 DAYS, straight time,  and ordered a commitment to issue.  Filed, signed Order For Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions.
cab
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($300.00) gj

Defendant Sade C Teague in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm  

Statements made as to sentencing.  Additional statement/s by:

AS TO COUNT 1
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 MONTHS CONSECUTIVE , with credit for 46 DAYS time served; 
*   The Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction, with no release privileges. This time is STAYED pending request from probation agent.

AS TO COUNT 2
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  6 MONTHS CONSECUTIVE to Count 1 and 3 with credit for ZERO days time served; 
*   The Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction, with no release privileges. This time is STAYED pending request from probation agent.

AS TO COUNT 3
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 5 MONTHS CONSECUTVE to Count 1 and 2 , with credit for ZERO DAYS time served; 
*   The Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction, with no release privileges. This time is STAYED pending request from probation agent.

The Court STAYED this sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 2 YEARS with the following conditions:
*   Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
*   Obtain an AODA assessment and follow-up treatment;
*   Maintain absolute sobriety
*   No contact with victim. 
*   Defendant to have a mental health evaluation and cooperate with any treatment.
*   Defendant to participate in parenting classes.
*   Obtain/maintain employment; 
*   Pay supervision fees;
*   Provide a DNA sample (if not already done so).
*   Pay all remaining costs, surcharges and assessments, any cash bail to apply, remaining balance  to be paid during the period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
.

Filed Pretrial Incarceration Credit;   Memorandum of Conditions of probation.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Sade C Teague in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Sarra Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Amended criminal complaint and information filed charging:

Count 1:  Misdemeanor Battery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1), 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.

Count 2:  Misdemeanor Battery,  contrary to Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1), 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.

Count 3:  Bail Jumping,  contrary to Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a), 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.
.
  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant will change her plea.
.
As to all 3 counts:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
.
Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 36.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 30, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

15RM026965  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05/30/15

Defendant Sade C Teague NOT in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Received & Filed, Justice Point Violation Report: Positive Drug Test & Absconding after ordered to appear in court. Discussion regarding violation.  Defendant failing to Justice Point, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued forthwith. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited, but held pending restitution and recompense. Court VACATED the Plea & Sentencing date of 7/7/2015.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY, to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers. No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No firearms/dangerous weapons, comply with no contact order.

Received & Filed, Stipulation and Order Regarding Use of Videotaped Statements.

Defendant Sade C Teague in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with LP (12/7/07) UNLESS AS APPROVED PER CHILDREN'S COURT ORDERS, OR IF CHILDREN'S COURT IS NOT INVOLVED, UNLESS AS APPROVED AND MONITORED BY THE BUREAU OF MILWAUKEE CHILD WELFARE.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Sade C Teague in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Sade C Teague in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge GRADY, Branch 23.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
